name: The Chinese Woman Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of Noreen's new boyfriend?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	In the previous episode, "The Pledge Drive", Elaine managed to break up Noreen and her boyfriend Dan because Dan was high-talker.  Whenever Elaine tried to call Noreen, she couldn't figure out if she was talking to Dan or Noreen, so she managed to accidentally tell Dan that Noreen was flirting with Jerry.  Elaine tells Jerry that Noreen met Paul as they are walking to Jerry's apartment from the grocery store.  She also tells Jerry that Paul is a long-talker because he doesn't put down the phone when she calls.

questions.text: While walking down the street, Jerry and Elaine see Frank Costanza talking to a man.  What odd piece of clothing is the man wearing?
questions.explanation:
A cape.

	Jerry points this out to Elaine and finds it odd that Frank is meeting with a man wearing a cape.  Frank claims that the man is his lawyer later in the episode.  The man playing his lawyer is actually Larry David.  In order to prevent Frank from seeing them, Elaine holds her bags up and blocks her and Jerry's faces from view.

questions.text: Whose phone lines are crossed with Donna Chang's?
questions.explanation:
George's.

	When George leaves a message on Jerry's machine, Jerry tries to call him back, but he can't get through.  He ends up talking to Donna Chang for a while since her lines are crossed with George's, and they decide to go on a date.  Jerry is excited to go on a date with a Chinese woman, but when he arrives at the Chinese restaurant to meet her, he finds out that she's not Chinese.

questions.text: What kind of underwear does Kramer wear in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Jockeys.

	In the beginning of the episode, a conversation starts between Elaine and Kramer about underwear and Elaine says that Kramer should get his sperm count tested in case he wants children.  When the test results come back, Kramer ends up making a big decision and he gives Jerry all of his underwear.

questions.text: In order to avoid talking to Noreen's new boyfriend, Elaine pretends to be talking on a car phone.  What does she use to simulate the sound of speaking on a car phone?
questions.explanation:
A hair dryer.

	When Elaine tries to talk to Noreen in her apartment, Paul ends up picking up the phone again and she uses the hair dryer idea.  He ends up continuing to talk and eventually, she has to pretend that the car is running out of gas in order to stop the conversation.  Eventually, she refuses to talk to him entirely.

questions.text: What does Frank Costanza like about Manhattan?
questions.correct: The fact that there are no mosquitoes
options: The fact that there are no murders
The fact that there are no birds
The fact that there are no homeless people
questions.explanation:
The fact that there are no mosquitoes.

	George ends up taking his father out for lunch at Monk's and he asks about the man in the cape that Elaine and Jerry saw.  This is where Frank reveals that it was his lawyer, but Frank doesn't really care about that, he's more concerned with the fact that Jerry and Elaine never said 'hello' to him.

questions.text: Who ends up with Noreen in the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	After the brief relationship with the high-talker, Elaine managed to break Noreen up with him, and she managed to meet the long-talker.  After they break up (because of Elaine), Kramer makes a move and decides to help Noreen.  Prior to this, Noreen joined the army because of Elaine, and then she went AWOL.  This is the last episode that Noreen appears in.

questions.text: Elaine is the only member of the group who doesn't actually meet Donna Chang.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When George meets Donna, he's surprised that she's not Chinese.  She ends up telling George that she spoke with his mother because the lines were crossed.  Elaine meets Donna after breaking up Noreen and Paul.  At this point, she tells Elaine and Jerry that the Constanzas aren't getting divorced.

Long Island.

	Donna Chang tells George that his parents are splitting up when they first meet and he is so devastated by this that he sticks his head into Jerry's oven.  Jerry thinks that if this had happened thirty years earlier, George might have been normal.Donna Chang manages to persuade Estelle to stay with Frank by giving her words of wisdom from Confucius, but when they go to the Constanzas' house for a visit, Estelle feels that she's been duped because she didn't get advice from a Chinese woman.

questions.text: Are Estelle and Frank split up in the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	In the end, Frank and Estelle don't actually get divorced although in future episodes, they are separated for a brief period.  Estelle says that Donna Cheng was the one responsible for keeping them together, but then when they meet, she decides to split up with Frank.  George gets angry that they've split up because now he has to travel around to see them.
